ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I developed business and professional skills. I really learned how to take my ideas and explain/present them to others, which is extremely helpful in the real-world.
I learned how to write technical reports and give presentations.

Learned a lot about scientific writing/reading, as well as improved my communication skills when talking about my research. For example, the elevator pitch exercise at the beginning of the semester taught me to introduce a complex topic in a short amount of time in a way that made sense.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments:
It probably didn't need all those sections. There was at least a week or two when it felt like the exercises covered in section were unnecessary or could have been condensed.

Otherwise, very good course.

A final presentation and research paper is a lot, and has definitely added a lot of stress to finals period, but other than that, this class was taught extremely well and I feel like I have learned a lot.
Lectures don't need to be given every week. However the slides presented were very well presented and organized
The course was extremely well organized and set up to let us do research and also practice writing reports and presentations. Another strength was having the speakers come in.

Strengths: the small class size really facilitated personalized feedback from/discussion with peers which was really valuable. Also, each of the "milestones", or assignments that we had in some way improved my understanding of my project or improved my skills in talking/writing about it (although they were a lot of work). I also loved hearing from three (unless I'm forgetting one) people who came to talk with us, they each offered such a unique perspective for us to learn from. And of course my project itself was something I was really interested in and looked forward to working on every week. 

Weakness: can't really think of any...!

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Absolutely. It is a great way to do an actual project or research and get credit for it. I will be taking this course again in the future.
Yes!! I feel this class gave me a glimpse into the real-world and will definitely help with presentations/meetings at jobs and internships.
I liked my project so I would recommend it. Totally depends on project
Yes - it is a great way to be able to do research during the school year and be able to explore mechanical engineering outside of the classroom.

YES, if you have a good project and you find a good mentor! I really enjoyed my project so I looked forward to working on it every week, which was important. However, I will say that producing work I was proud of was a BIG time commitment, so I would make sure you're ready for that and have time set aside several times a week to work on the project. Weekly meetings with my mentor were critical in keeping me on track. 

With regards to the assignments themselves, feedback I got in this class by far exceeds that I've received in any other STEM class, and we received it very soon after the assignment was submitted/presented which allowed for immediate implementation of the suggested changes. The guidelines and expectations for each milestone were very clear, so I knew exactly what was expected of me and how I could achieve that. Prof Bennett's expectations were high, which pushed me to put forward work I was proud of. She was always happy to review an assignment before the deadline to provide additional feedback.
